results.title: The Silver whistle
results.brief_description: A puppet animated fairytale, about a heroine who uses her magic whistle to break the spell of a beautiful but wicked witch, and charms a prince with her wit, goodness, prudence, and freckles. Designed to develop language arts skills. Charming and fey, this modern fairytale employs a crude and colourful animation style in the service of its gentle, whimsical nature.

results.title: The Silver haul
results.creator_credit: Guy Blanchard, James Mellor and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: Details of the British herring industry including buying, selling, marketing and making a haul. Demonstrates the laying of the nets and landing of fish; the gutting and grading, either by hand of mechanically, of the catch which may be kippered, salted, qucik frozen or shipped fresh on ice. Summarizes the history of the industry.

results.title: The Silver Greyhound
results.brief_description: The work of the Queen’s Foreign Service messengers, who carry the diplomatic despatches from the Foreign Office in London to British embassies all over the world. In these modern times, we see how he journeys by air - where, for hundreds of years, his predecessors went by post-chaise or on horse-back. In those days, each man carried a pair of pistols and a sword. Today — an outsize passport, printed and bound in red. One thing only persists - the secret token once used as a pass-sign, a relic of the War of the Roses - the Silver Greyhound.

results.title: The Silver Brumby. Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Colin South, John Tatoulis and Media World Feature Production
results.brief_description: Features two episodes set in the high country and based on Elyne Mitchell’s book “The Silver brumby”:FLIGHT TO FREEDOM; The beautiful daughter of The Brolga, Boon Boon, proves herself capable of leaving the secure environment of her family when she joins Thowra in a plight to save the brumbies from a brumby hunt: THE OLD PROSPECTOR SAVES A FRIEND; Thowra learns a valuable lesson about humans when evil men set traps in the high country. A friendly prospector helps Silky’s Joey recover after being caught in a trap and proves to Thowra that not all men are bad. However, it will take all of the creatures help, including wombat, to stop more creatures from getting hurt. Features the voices of Charles “Bud” Tingwell, John Stanton, Rebecca Gibney and Marg Downey.

results.title: The Silver brumby
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World Features
results.brief_description: Based on Elyne Mitchell’s famous novel, “The Silver Brumby” is set in the Australian Alps, where a rogue stallion is king of the mob of horses which roam the awesome landscape. For years, the mountain men have tried to capture him, but with no success. One horseman is determined to succeed where others have failed and embarks on an unforgettable adventure. Starring Russell Crowe, Caroline Goodall and Ami Daemion.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

results.title: The Silent battle
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The disease of tuberculosis and the methods being adopted to fight it. Tuberculosis in the 19th century was the deadliest and most widespread disease in the western world. The “wasting sickness” spread until the bacillus was isolated and the X-ray machine invinted. Microphotography shows the white corpuscle attacking the bacilli and forming lesions. The work of the mobile X-ray units. Revolutionary changes in treatmnet with new drugs. By constant vigilance the disease can be kept in check.

results.title: The Signal Hill tattoo
results.creator_credit: Paul MacLeod, Memorial University of Newfoundland and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A period of history brought to life as student recruits re-enact a British regimental drill that took place regularly in the old colonial city of St. John’s, Newfoundland, in the mid-19th century. This film follows some of the training, then describes the colorful military display on Signal Hill overlooking the city, as the smartly uniformed soldiers go through the maneuvers to the sound of bugles, drums, cannon and musket fire.

results.title: The Signal engineers
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: The signal engineer plays a vital part in Brtiain’s railway services. With modern equipment and systems rapidly replacing defunct methods, the signal-man’s task has become a complex one, demanding high standards of technical skill. His contribution to train control and passenger safety is illustrated.

results.title: The Siege of Tobruk
results.brief_description: For 246 days Australian Infantry and British troops held the town of Tobruk. This film records the highlights of the seige which began on 9th April, 1941. Day and night the guns in and around the town were manned and only once was the garrison breached. The “back door” of Tobruk, the port, was kept open, although there were sunken ships in the harbor. Plans were made for the capture of enemy strongholds in Libya and the climax of the film is reached with the capture and holding of the El Dodo ridge by the Tobruk garrison. For nine days they held the ridge until the arrival of the British Eighth Army. Outlines the events leading up to and during the siege. Includes action shots of the capture of enemy positions in the course of breaking of the siege.

results.title: The Sick Stockrider
results.brief_description: An early Australian silent film , by the makers of “The Reprieve”’ which appeared in the same year. A version of Adam Lindsay Gordon’s poem, which appeared stanza by stanza before the illustrative sequences. The dying stockrider recalls his past life : mustering, ploughing, horsebreaking and pursuing bushrangers; and remembers his old friends and what became of them.
